channel.title: Who covers reseller expenses
channel.description: If I have SaaS resellers that are paid a percentage of the monthly subscription and the reseller was doing sales and maketing who would cover those expenses (advertising, creating brochures etc). I assume the reseller would cover anything outside of our standard collateral otherwise the percentage we pay them would be just straight profit.

item.title: Who covers reseller expenses
item.dc:creator: pjc
item.description:
If you’re paying their expenses, they are your employee/contractor, not a reseller.

Read full topic

item.title: Who covers reseller expenses
item.dc:creator: Andy
item.description:
It would be weird to pay a reseller’s expenses. What would be the point of the reseller? Just run the ads yourself and keep 100% of the sale. If they are paying for stuff, that’s good - it means they have some skin in the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Who covers reseller expenses
item.dc:creator: craigvn
item.description:
If I have SaaS resellers that are paid a percentage of the monthly subscription and the reseller was doing sales and maketing who would cover those expenses (advertising, creating brochures etc). I assume the reseller would cover anything outside of our standard collateral otherwise the percentage we pay them would be just straight profit.
